title: 113_s684
content: The "Mni Wiconi Project Act Amendments of 2013" is introduced to provide assistance for completing rural water supply systems for the Oglala Sioux, Rosebud Sioux, and Lower Brule Sioux tribes. The Secretary, in consultation with relevant tribes and federal agencies, will develop plans to complete rural water supply systems for the Oglala Sioux, Rosebud Sioux, and Lower Brule Sioux tribes. Plans will include completing remaining components, improving existing systems, and transferring ownership of existing systems. The Secretary will transfer existing water systems to the United States for the Oglala Sioux Tribe, Rosebud Sioux Tribe, or Lower Brule Sioux Tribe to be part of the rural water system. Within 2 years of enactment, plans and implementation schedules will be submitted to Congress for completion within 15 years. The report must include descriptions of the roles and responsibilities of Federal agency heads, program authorities, and how they will collaborate to complete and implement water supply system plans. The Secretary must enter into agreements with other Federal agencies to provide assistance to the Oglala Sioux Tribe, the Rosebud Sioux Tribe, or the Lower Brule Sioux Tribe. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development must work with other Federal agencies to fulfill the trust responsibility of the United States and complete rural water systems for the Oglala Sioux, Rosebud Sioux, and Lower Brule Sioux Tribes. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development is responsible for completing rural water systems for the Oglala Sioux, Rosebud Sioux, and Lower Brule Sioux Tribes, with assistance from the Environmental Protection Agency in meeting environmental and safe drinking water needs. This includes improving existing systems, constructing new facilities, and addressing necessary features. The Secretary of Health and Human Services shall assist in meeting the water supply and public health needs of the Pine Ridge, Rosebud, and Lower Brule Indian Reservations, including compliance with the Indian Sanitation Facilities Act. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development will help connect eligible houses on the reservations of the Oglala Sioux Tribe, Rosebud Sioux Tribe, and Lower Brule Sioux Tribe to their respective rural water supply systems to meet water conservation standards. Additionally, the Secretary of Agriculture will assist in livestock distribution systems. The Secretary of Agriculture, in collaboration with the Bureau of Indian Affairs, will complete the livestock distribution system for the Oglala Sioux Rural Water Supply System and the Rosebud Sioux Rural Water System within 15 years. Agreements will be made to outline the responsibilities of each agency for construction. The Department of the Interior, specifically the Bureau of Reclamation, will lead the construction of livestock distribution systems. Each agency head will use available funds to carry out their duties, and other federal agency funds can also be utilized. The Oglala Sioux Tribe may request additional funding as needed. The Oglala Sioux Tribe, Rosebud Sioux Tribe, and Lower Brule Sioux Tribe are prohibited from seeking federal funds for any other purpose. The Bureau of Indian Affairs will assist in upgrading plumbing fixtures and other necessary features to connect homes to rural water systems for the mentioned tribes. SEC. 3. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS. Section 10(a) of the Mni Wiconi Project Act of 1988 is amended to adjust funding levels and timelines for planning, design, and construction. The amendments include changes to the amounts based on different price levels and updated years. The Mni Wiconi Project Act of 1988 is amended to adjust funding levels and timelines for planning, design, and construction of the System, Rosebud Sioux Rural Water Supply System, and Lower Brule Sioux Water Supply System. Amendments include changes to operation and maintenance fees and fee basis. The Mni Wiconi Project Act of 1988 is amended to adjust funding levels and timelines for planning, design, and construction of the System, Rosebud Sioux Rural Water Supply System, and Lower Brule Sioux Water Supply System. Amendments include changes to operation and maintenance fees and fee basis. Additionally, upgrades for community water systems on specific Indian Reservations are addressed. The Mni Wiconi Project Act of 1988 is amended to transfer title of water systems to the United States for the benefit of applicable Indian tribes within 15 years of enactment. The Secretary will use authorized funds for improvements, repairs, and replacements of transferred water systems. The Mni Wiconi Project Act of 1988 is amended to transfer and improve water systems for applicable Indian tribes within 15 years of enactment. The Mni Wiconi Project Act of 1988 is amended to reduce the Federal share of project costs by $15,000,000 for the project authorized by section 1617 of the Reclamation Projects Authorization and Adjustment Act of 1992. This amendment aims to facilitate the completion of the Mni Wiconi Rural Water Supply System.
